content:
• Tuesday, May 13, 2014
  • FIVN

    Five9 beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Five9 (NASDAQ:FIVN): Q1 EPS of -$1.55 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $24.27M (+27.0% Y/Y) beats by $1.4M.
    • Shares +4.64% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: LOJN +19.9%. ARTX +11.6%. TC +5.6%. TWGP +4.3%. PINC +3.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: URS -8.9%. SCSS -5.4%. FOSL -5.3%. SRC -4.0%. TTWO -3.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • FOSL

    Fossil -5% as Q1 brings lower profit, higher expenses

    • Fossil (NASDAQ:FOSL) -5.1% AH after Q1 earnings declined 8.2% Y/Y, as higher operating expenses more than offset sales growth in its watch market.
    • Q1 revenues hit the high end of company guidance by jumping 14% to $776.5M, driven by growth in sales of watches and jewelry, but operating expenses climbed 19% to $338.5M; sees continued higher expenses in 2014 and views this year as a transition to investing in infrastructure to investment in areas that will fuel growth.
    • Retail same-store sales fell 2.4% Y/Y, as a decline in North America largely was driven by a drop in mall traffic, while direct-to-customer sales rose 18%.
    • Issues downside guidance for Q2, seeing EPS of $0.90-$0.97 vs. $1.17 analyst consensus estimate and revenue growth of 8%-9.5% ($762M-$832M) vs. $774M consensus.
    • Issues downside guidance for FY 2014, seeing EPS of $6.90-$7.30 vs. $7.22 consensus while reiterating revenue growth guidance of 8%-10% ($3.52B-$3.58B) vs. $3.58B consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • ARTX

    Arotech Corporation beats by $0.04, betas on revenue

    • Arotech Corporation (NASDAQ:ARTX): FQ1 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $22.4M (+1% Y/Y) beats by $1.1M.
    • Shares +11.6%
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • DK

    Delek US in 9.2M-share secondary offering

    • Delek US Holdings (NYSE:DK) -2.4% AH after announcing a secondary offering of 9.2M common shares by selling stockholders Delek Hungary Holding; the underwriters will have the option to purchase up to an additional 1.38M shares.
    • DK will receive no proceeds from the offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • QTWW

    Quantum Fuel Systems misses by $0.11, misses on revenue

    • Quantum Fuel Systems (NASDAQ:QTWW): FQ1 EPS of -$0.16 misses by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $7.95M (+80.3% Y/Y) misses by $4.7M.
    • Shares +3.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYCC

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals beats by $0.01

    • Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CYCC): Q1 EPS of -$0.25 beats by $0.01.
    • Shares +2.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • TTWO

    Light guidance sends Take-Two lower AH, even as current quarter beats

    • Take-Two Interactive (NASDAQ:TTWO) -1.7% AH after reporting FQ4 earnings and revenues that easily beat expectations but issuing downside guidance for the current quarter and fiscal year.
    • In FQ4, steady sales of new videogame titles including "Grand Theft Auto" were not enough to prevent a 23% drop in revenue over the year-ago quarter when results benefited from the release of "BioShock Infinite."
    • Guidance for Q1 sees EPS loss of $0.35-$0.25 vs. analysts consensus estimate of a $0.12 loss, and revenues of $120M-$135M vs. $223M consensus.
    • FY 2015 guidance forecasts EPS of $0.80-$1.05 vs. $1.10 consensus and revenues of $1.35B-$1.45B vs. $1.38B consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 6 Comments
  • AMBR

    Amber Road beats by $0.19, beats on revenue

    • Amber Road (NYSE:AMBR): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.19.
    • Revenue of $14.98M (+29.2% Y/Y) beats by $1.34M.
    • Shares +1.04% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • CNAT

    Conatus Pharmaceuticals misses by $0.01

    • Conatus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CNAT): Q1 EPS of -$0.34 misses by $0.01.
    • Shares +6.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • KO

    Analyst: Coca-Cola "fully engaged" in GMCR, sees value in single serve

    • Today’s news that Coca-Cola (KO +0.6%) has increased its equity position in Keurig Green Mountain (GMCR +7.5%) to 16% from the original 10% purchase leads Canaccord analysts to believe that KO favorably views GMCR's positioning and growth opportunity in coffee, and has confidence in the upcoming Keurig Cold launch.
    • Regardless of the timing of adding to its stake, Canaccord says the move illustrates the value in single-serve and with Coke as a 16% holder, "the strongest potential partner in cold beverages is fully engaged" with a significant material interest in the upcoming Keurig Cold launch, and the stake also could boost GMCR's valuation reflecting the addition of a premium over the speculation of a future take-out by KO.  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 7 Comments
  • PLUG

    Plug Power rallies on guidance, FuelCell wins new Posco deal

    • Plug Power (PLUG +7.2%) and FuelCell Energy (FCEL +8.1%) are bouncing back today after each produces announcements that keep the bears at bay, at least until PLUG issues its earnings report tomorrow morning.
    • At a Wedbush conference, PLUG reaffirmed its FY 2014 guidance, expecting to ship more than 3K units, hit $70M in sales (vs. $65M analyst consensus estimate) and 25% gross margins; expects EBITDA to break even during Q2 and Q3.
    • Meanwhile, FCEL said it won a new contract with Posco (NYSE:PKX), South Korea’s largest steel maker and, Bloomberg notes, the company’s largest shareholder.
    • Also moving up nicely: BLDP +6.6%, ZBB +3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 9 Comments
  • CSUN

    China Sunergy +14% on Q1 guidance hike

    • China Sunergy (CSUN +14.1%) now expects Q1 solar cell/module shipments to be above a prior guidance range of 130MW-140MW. Gross margin is still expected to be in a mid-single digit range.
    • The guidance hike comes 6 days after Canadian Solar hiked its Q1 shipment forecast. Yingli and Trina previously issued Q1 warnings.
    • Full Q1 results are due on May 28.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • RDEN

    Cosmetics sector painted red after Elizabeth Arden disappoints

    • An alarming drop in sales by Elizabeth Arden (RDEN -21.1%) has rocked the fragrance and cosmetics sectors.
    • The read weak U.S. demand from the company and a heavily promotional atmosphere overseas has put some more tension in the air.
    • Decliners: Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) -1.1%, Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) -1.5%, Nu Skin (NYSE:NUS) -1.2%, Inter Parfums (NASDAQ:IPAR) -1.3%, Revlon (NYSE:REV) -1.1%, Coty (NYSE:COTY) -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 3 Comments
  • TWGP

    Tower Group soars after new buyout proposal aired

    • Euroins Insurance Group has made a $3.75/share offer for Tower Group (TWGP +13.8%), subject to due diligence and "negotiation and execution of a definitive written agreement." The offer price soundly exceeds the ACP Re's (AFSI +0.1%) revised $2.50/share bid.
    • Tower shares are currently at $2.55, after having momentarily spiked as high as $3.01.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: TWGP +34%. UEC +29%. GORO +25%. OTCQB:TELK +23%. ANCI +22%. XGTI +18%. EVDY +17%. LOAN +16%. OHRP +16%. HALO +15%.
    • Top 10 Losers: DXPE -39%. RDEN -20%. FTEK -20%. TCCO -19%. OMEX -18%. INTX -15%. OTC:ACFN -15%. OTC:CACH -15%. DCIX -14%. CALL -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced, Rubicon gain on Dougherty coverage launches

    • Dougherty has started coverage on GT Advanced (GTAT +3.4%) and Rubicon (RBCN +3.1%) at Buy. The firm has set a $27 PT for the former, and an $11 PT for the latter.
    • Dougherty is upbeat about GT's Apple deal and new products, and expects long-struggling Rubicon to post strong top-line growth going forward on the back of healthy LED/smartphone sapphire demand.
    • GT sold off last week after missing Q1 revenue estimates and reiterating full-year guidance. Rubicon tumbled two weeks after posting mixed Q1 results and below-consensus Q2 guidance.
    • 29% and 30% of GT and Rubicon's floats were respectively shorted as of April 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 5 Comments
  • PBA

    Pembina plans new pipeline, third fractionator at Redwater in $460M project

    • Pembina Pipeline (PBA +2.5%) says it will proceed with construction on a new 55K bbl/day propane-plus fractionator at its existing Redwater fractionation and storage complex along with an associated pipeline at an estimated cost of $460M.
    • RFS III, which is underpinned by long-term take-or-pay contracts with multiple producers, will be the third fractionator at the Redwater complex and will leverage the design and engineering work completed for PBA's first and second fractionators which process mixed natural gas liquids into ethane, propane and butane.
    • The news prompts an upgrade from Canaccord Genuity to Buy from Hold.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • DXI

    Dejour Energy moves higher on strong financial results

    • Dejour Energy (DEJ +3.2%) shares are higher after the company reports a 44% Y/Y increase in daily production in Q1, a 37% increase in gross revenues, and a 283% increase in operating cash flow.
    • Operating netbacks for oil and gas operations of $55.53/boe and $13.85/boe respectively, 60% and 575% increases over comparable operating netbacks in the prior-year quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • PRKR

    ParkerVision slips following Q1 report, CC

    • Thanks in part to lower litigation spend following the end of last year's Qualcomm trial, ParkerVision's (OTC:PRKR -3.4%) opex fell 11% Y/Y in Q1 to $5.79M. R&D spend fell 4% to $2.26M.
    • Following a March private placement that yielded net proceeds of $11.9M, the company ended Q1 with $25.3M in cash/securities available for sale.
    • On the CC (transcript), CFO Cindy Poehlman mentioned ParkerVision expects to use $4M-$4.5M/quarter in cash for operations over the rest of 2014, assuming no liquidity from licensing/product revenue.
    • 2014 litigation costs for ParkerVision's new suit against Qualcomm and HTC are expected to be in the $1M-$1.5M range.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • POWR

    PowerSecure bounces on buyback announcement

    • With shares having crashed in response to a big Q1 miss and worse guidance, PowerSecure (POWR +4.6%) says it plans to start using an existing $5M buyback authorization, and will "explore options to expand and extend" it. (8-K)
    • PowerSecure had $38.2M in cash at the end of Q1, but that figure represented a $12.7M Q/Q decline.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • DQ

    Daqo lower after posting Q1 results, announcing stock offering

    • Along with its Q1 numbers, Daqo (DQ -7.4%) has announced it's selling 2M shares to help pay for expansion/tech upgrades. At current levels, the offering would raise $70M, and increase Daqo's share count by 28%. Underwriters have a 300K-share overallotment option.
    • Polysilicon shipments rose to 1,391MT in Q1 from 1,271MT in Q4 and 706MT a year ago. Shipments are expected to grow to 1,375MT-1,400MT in Q2.
    • Annual production capacity is currently at 6,150MT. Daqo is aiming to eventually grow capacity to 25,000MT. The company asserts its polysilicon cash cost (now $11.8/kg) and production cost ($14.5/kg) are among the lowest in the industry.
    • Gross margin was 30.2%, a marked improvement from Q4's 18.5% and the year-ago period's -22.3%. Excluding a $1.8M reversal of doubtful accounts, SG&A spend fell to $3.3M from $4M in Q4 and $4.1M a year ago. R&D spend was at $0.9M vs. $1.1M and $0.4M.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • T

    AT&T, Vodafone slide following DirecTV reports

    • Bloomberg and WSJ reports suggesting AT&T (T -1.3%) is close to a mega-deal for DirecTV (DTV +0.7%) (possibly worth over $66B after factoring net debt) are leading investors to bet Ma Bell won't be interested in making a bid for Vodafone (VOD -2.2%), something the company has been frequently rumored to be interested in exploring.
    • AT&T CEO Randall Stephenson has already said "the window may be closing" on acquiring European assets, and has suggested he isn't thrilled with Vodafone's efforts to grow its wireline footprint via M&A.
    • For his part, Vodafone CEO Vittorio Colao has hinted he's open to a deal, but has also made it clear his company will continue its wireline expansion strategy in the interim.
    • AT&T, which didn't sell off following prior DirecTV reports, is off moderately today, as the Street expresses some concern over the potential $100/share price tag mentioned in Bloomberg's report.
    • DirecTV (DTV +0.7%), meanwhile, has pared its AH gains and is now only trading near $88. Worries about regulatory approval might be playing a role; a Bloomberg source states AT&T and DirecTV are expecting a 12-month regulatory process for the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 7 Comments
  • CTB

    Cooper Tire & Rubber gets a boost from Northcoast Research

    • Cooper Tire & Rubber (CTB +3.3%) moves higher after Northcoast Research sets a Buy rating on the tire seller.
    • Shares of CTB are at their highest level of the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • HMIN

    Home Inns & Hotels Management higher following earnings

    • Shares of Home Inns & Hotels Management (HMIN +6.8%) gain after the company beats with its Q1 report.
    • Soft market conditions led to a drop in the company's occupancy rate during the period.
    • The average daily rate for the period was flat compared to last year at $156.
    • Q2 guidance from the company beat the expectation of some analysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • NFEC

    NF Energy reports Q1 earnings, shares jump

    • NF Energy (NASDAQ:NFEC): Q1 net loss of $0.1M.
    • Revenue of $1.74M (+34.9% Y/Y).
    • Shares +20.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • TWER

    Towerstream higher in spite of revenue miss, light guidance

    • Towerstream (TWER +2.6%) is guiding for Q2 fixed wireless revenue of $7.5M-$7.8M (compares with Q1's $7.69M) and shared wireless infrastructure revenue of $800K-$900K (up from Q1's $740K). That suggests revenue will be below a $9.3M consensus. But with shares having closed yesterday near their 52-week low of $1.45, investors had priced in some bad news.
    • Q1 net cash flow was -$4.85M vs. -$5.27M in Q4 and -$3.4M a year ago. Towerstream's cash/equivalent balance fell to $21.2M from $28.2M at the end of Q4.
    • Fixed wireless revenue -6% Y/Y, shared infrastructure revenue rose over 4x. ARPU was $758, down from $761M in Q4 but up from $727 a year ago. Churn rose to 2.33% from 1.78% in Q4 and 1.63% a year ago.
    • Gross margin was 30%, up from 27% in Q4 but down from 40% a year ago. Opex was nearly flat Y/Y at $14.8M. Capex totaled $2.53M (30% of revenue).
    • Q1 results, PR, CC transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy, POSCO Energy deepen relationship

    • FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) strengthens its relationship with POSCO Energy (NYSE:PKX), with the companies set to work together to win multinational customers that express interest in projects in each others territory, and they'll further integrate their global supply chain.
    • FuelCell has also sold 5.6 megawatts of fuel cell modules to POSCO Energy to meet growing Asian demand.
    • FuelCell's shares are +3.5%. (PR)
    • Previous
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 2 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: HALO +16%. RAX +13%. GORO +12%. TC +6%. IFON +6%. GMCR +6%.
    • Losers: INTX -22%. RDEN -21%. BIOF -16%. CALL -10%. IDRA -8%. INSY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • FTEK

    Fuel Tech -18% following big Q1 miss

    • Fuel Tech (NASDAQ:FTEK) -18% premarket after reporting worse than expected Q1 earnings and revenues, reflecting slower U.S. activity and a decline in activity from a large project in Chile that is nearing completion.
    • Capital projects backlog in the air pollution control segment stood at $15M at the end of Q1 vs. $22.4M for the prior quarter; FTEK says Q1 backlog does not include results from the April acquisition of PECO-FGC, which exceeded $10M.
    • FTEK believes its APC business due to April's Supreme Court decision upholding the EPA's Cross State Air Pollution Rule.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • TWX

    Time Warner upgraded by Bernstein ahead of Time Inc. spinoff

    • Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) is raised to an Outperform rating from Market Perform by analysts at Bernstein.
    • The investment firm also adds $11 to its price target to take it to $84.
    • The upcoming distribution of Time Inc. has analysts divided on if buying before or after the distribution is a smarter play.
    • TWX +1.0% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • CLNY

    NorthStar Realty -2.7% after pricing secondary

    • The 30M share offering priced at $15.45 each.
    • NRF -2.7% premarket to $15.42
    • Previously: NorthStar Realty -2.3% after secondary launch
     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM

  • Retail sales: Where's the post-winter bounce?

    • Treasurys have their tails in the air following the slow April retail sales print. Down ahead of the number, TLT +04% and the 10-year Treasury yield is now lower by three basis points to 2.63%.
    • TBT -0.8%
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TTT, TMF, ZROZ, SBND, TLH, DLBS, VGLT, UBT, TLO, TENZ, LBND, TYBS, DLBL
     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 11 Comments
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti +3.8% on Raymond James upgrade

    • Raymond James has upgraded Ubiquiti (NASDAQ:UBNT) to Strong Buy from Outperform. The firm's PT is at $50.
    • The upgrade comes after shares nosedived in the wake of Ubiquiti's FQ3 beat, thanks to concerns about rising inventories and Americas/enterprise sales growth.
    • 22% of the float was shorted as of April 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM | 7 Comments
  • HSH

    Hillshire Brands in focus following strategic acquisition

    • Shares of Hillshire Brands (NYSE:HSH) are higher in premarket trading with more analysts backing the company's move to buy Pinnacle Foods (NYSE:PF) as a strategic long-term play.
    • Some investors sold off Hillshire yesterday after the company removed its "pure-play" label through its acquisition of Pinnacle and with some speculation a ratings agency downgrade could be down the road.
    • During a conference call with analysts, Hillshire execs said the deal will deliver "enhanced scale, capabilities, and margins, along with input cost diversification."
    • Morningstar agrees, noting product diversity and scale could help smooth out margin fluctuations.
    • Hillshire conference call transcript
    • HSH +1.9% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • PTN

    Palatin Tech misses by $0.02

    • Palatin Tech (NYSEMKT:PTN): FQ3 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.02.
    • Shares +19.3% PM.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • WB

    Weibo +2% on Goldman coverage launch

    • A day after one IPO underwriter (Piper) assigned Weibo (NASDAQ:WB) a bullish rating, another (Goldman) has done the same, launching coverage with a Buy and $24 PT.
    • Following a 9.3% gain yesterday, shares are now up 17% from their $17 IPO price. They trade at 8.4x 2015E sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 AM
  • HALO

    Panel recommends resumption of testing for Halozyme cancer drug

    • Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO) has requested that the FDA lift a clinical hold on its PEGPH20 treatment for pancreatic cancer after the Data Monitoring Committee (DMC) in a Phase II trial of the drug said it now supports, with modifications, the continued enrollment of patients in the study.
    • Halozyme suspended the testing last month following a recommendation from the DMC so that the company could investigate whether the drug increased the risk of thromboembolic events, or blocked blood vessels.
    • Shares are +13% premarket. (PR)
    • Halozyme Q1 earnings
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM | 2 Comments
  • RDEN

    Elizabeth Arden dives after weak report on sales

    • Shares of Elizabeth Arden (NASDAQ:RDEN) dive after the company reports a 20% falloff in sales on weak demand for perfume in North America.
    • Previous: FQ3 results, strategic alternatives
    • The company is in full cost-slashing mode, but the transition wasn't quick enough to prevent it from falling into the red.
    • RDEN -13.6% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM
  • KO

    Coca-Cola raises stake in Keurig Green Mountain

    • Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) has raised its stake in Keurig Green Mountain (NASDAQ:GMCR) to 16% from 10%, according to a fresh SEC filing.
    • The stake makes Coca-Cola the largest Keurig shareholder and maxes out the position it can take pursuant to its deal terms with the company.
    • SEC Form 13D
    • GMCR +3.1% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 AM | 8 Comments
  • GORO

    Gold Resource beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Gold Resource (NYSEMKT:GORO): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $31.15M (-26.4% Y/Y) beats by $2.35M.
    • Shares +5.7% PM.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM

  • WSJ: Bundesbank open to significant ECB stimulus

    • Germany's Bundesbank is willing to support significant ECB stimulus if the latter's inflation forecasts for the period through 2016 are lowered, the WSJ reports.
    • Measures could include a negative rate on bank deposits and purchases of packaged bank loans as the Bundesbank lends its weight to the battle to stop low inflation becoming permanent and even becoming deflation. However, the bank is still resistant to large-scale purchases of public and private debt.
    • Still, the Bundesbank's readiness to counter stimulus marks a departure from its traditionally strong opposition to such action.
    • ETFs: FXE, VGK, EUO, FEZ, ERO, IEV, EU, EPV, EZU, HEDJ, DRR, FEU, FEP, UPV, EUFX, ULE, ADRU, FEEU, URR, EURL, EURZ, FIEU, DBEU
     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 AM

  • World stocks on the up

    • Global equities mostly rise following Wall Street's strong performance yesterday as investors focus on the improving U.S. economy rather than the tensions in Ukraine and more weak economic data out of China.
    • Indian shares continue to party on the strongish probability that Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party has won the country's general election.
    • Japan +1.9%, Hong Kong +0.4%, China -0.1%, India +1.3%.
    • Euro Stoxx 600 +0.1%, London +0.1%, Paris +0.1%, Frankfurt +0.5%, Milan +0.2%, Madrid +0.1%.
    • U.S. stock futures: Dow +0.15%. S&P +0.1%. Nasdaq +0.1%
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 AM | 1 Comment
